title.narrative: ENV - Strengthening Lumo Conservancy to Protect Wildlife and Provide Community Benefits Activity

description.narrative: (Kenya): The purpose of this activity is to strengthen the governance capacity of the nascent Lumo conservancy in the Tsavo landscapes in Kenya to ensure inclusive, transparent, equitable, and accountable conservancy governance systems that are necessary to combat poaching and conserve biodiversity. The implementing partner, African Wildlife Foundation, works in 17 different African countries and harnesses the best governance, policy and transparency practices from their vast experience to ensure wildlife and wildlands thrive in modern Africa. USAID will use FY 2018 funds to support the Lumo Conservancy board capacity assessment, and strengthen ranger training in wildlife monitoring and data analysis for improved decision-making. This activity will also support innovative ideas for enhancing biodiversity conservation, improving the connectivity of biodiversity hotspots, and strengthening anti-poaching and anti-trafficking efforts in the three target landscapes. This activity supports key Integrated Country Strategy priorities in Kenya by encouraging improved natural resource management to maximize benefits to Kenya citizens and help increase investment opportunities for Americans into the Kenya ecotourism sector. The activity also addresses USAID's self-reliance agenda by helping Kenya's conservancy stakeholders manage and plan for better conservancy governance systems, which in turn will help solve the development challenges in Kenya's conservancy/wildlife sector.
